patterns: I cant connect to the internet
how do i protect my origin server
responses: Contact your internet service provider, CDN or DDoS provider to get assistance.
Initiate your incident response plan
Never respond to extortion emails, even to refuse payment.
Regularly apply IT security patches to your website.
Consider mirroring part or all of your DNS infrastructure with DDoS resilient DNS providers.
Harden DNS servers against DDoS attacks.
Use a CDN or DDoS mitigation provider to front your online services.

patterns: my account has unusual account activity
how do i not have data breaches
what is the best way to avoid data breaches
All my data has been deleted
responses: Use multi-factor authentication for critical services, such as your online tax return or even email.
Back up important information.
Avoid re-using password.
Minimise the amount of personal information shared with an organisation.
Look for organisations that have a commitment to cyber security

patterns: My Login pages appears that dont look legitimate
how to i prevent a Man in the Middle attack
responses: Having a strong encryption mechanism on wireless access points prevents unwanted users from joining your network just by being nearby.
Its essential to make sure your default router login is changed
VPNs can be used to create a secure environment for sensitive information within a local area network
Check for proper page authentication
Implement some sort of tamper detection

patterns: How do I prevent employees using unauthorized data
Somebody has logged into my computer
responses: implement a system to block and log outgoing emails with sensitive keywords or data patterns
block the use of unapproved cloud computing services including personal webmail.
Keeping regular backups, which are only accessible to trusted staff, will reduce this risk.
Using multi-factor authentication so even if a malicious insider gets hold of a colleague's user id, it is difficult for them to get access to that account to perform malicious actions.

patterns: I have opened a suspicious email
how do i prevent phishing attacks
How do I prevent employees clicking on suspicious links
responses: Never open emails from unknown sources
Dont ever vist suspicious websites or ones that aren't safe
Update your devices and turn on automatic updates
Setup regular backups and restoration testing
Implement access control
Never pay a ransom if underattack
I real email will never ask for your user name, PIN, password or security questions and answers
Dont click on links in emails or messages, or open attachments, from people or organisations you dont know.
Use a spam filter to block deceptive messages from even reaching you.
Understand that your financial institution and other large organisation would never send you a link and ask you to enter your personal or financial details
Use a spam filter to block deceptive messages from even reaching you.

patterns: What can you help me with?
responses: I can help you with cybersecurity related questions. The questions that I can currently answer include: What are the most serious threats faced by organizations in my industry today? || What are the most serious cyber security threats faced by my business currently?

patterns: What are the most serious cyber security threats faced by my business currently?
Most serious cyber security threats for my business?
What cyber security threats do I face?
What are some cyber security threats my business face?
responses: First I will need to know more about your current security. What security systems are currently in place?
